results.title: In rats with myocardial infarction, interference by simvastatin with the TLR4 signal pathway attenuates ventricular remodelling.
results.text_hl: LVEDD and LVESD significantly increased and fractional shortening (FS) markedly decreased in the MI group. It was clear that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ inhibited @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathy_Dilated_with_Left_Ventricular_Noncompaction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C565277 @@@LV dilation@@@ and improved LV function after MI without affecting @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ size.

citations.NLM: Sheng FQ, Xu R, Cheng LX, Zeng QT, Gao W, Wang W, Dang SY, Wang CQ, He CR. In rats with myocardial infarction, interference by simvastatin with the TLR4 signal pathway attenuates ventricular remodelling. Acta Cardiol. 2009 Dec;64(6):779-85. PMID: 20128155
